author: cms-sw
body: To keep track of patches applied, by default `cmsBuild` was using `git init ; git add ; git commit` for each patch applied. This is a good way to create local patches when something failed but it consumes a lot time specially for packages with large code base ( pytorch, tensorflow etc.). This is a good option when debuging , so the PR proposes that by default `cmsBuild` do not use `git commit` for applied patches but one much enabled it using `--use-git-for-patches` command-line option
title: use git for patching on demand
